## ApplyPaddingToCoordinates() function

Starting from the borders, removes a percentage of the analyzed track source.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function ApplyPaddingToCoordinates(padding: number, coords: number[][]): number[][];
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  padding | number | The padding to apply. |
|  coords | number\[\]\[\] | The coordinates on which to apply the padding. |

<b>Returns:</b>

number\[\]\[\]

List of coordinates with the given padding applied.

## Example

Example: A video with resolution `640x480` would yield landmark coordinates where `[0, 0]` and `[1, 1]` correspond to pixel values of `[0, 0]` and `[639, 639]` respectively.

Setting padding to `0.05` would make `[0, 0]` and `[1, 1]` correspond to pixel values of `[639 * 0.05, 639 * 0.05]` and `[639 - 639 * 0.05, 639 - 639 * 0.05]` respectively.
